The code first takes an integer input n from the user.
If n is 0, the code prints 0 and exits.
The code then initializes a string variable ans to an empty string.
The code then enters a loop that iterates from 0 to 49.
For each iteration, the code checks if n is divisible by 2 to the power of (i+1).
If n is not divisible, the code subtracts 2 to the power of i from n and appends a 1 to the ans string.
If n is divisible, the code appends a 0 to the ans string.
The code checks if n is 0 after each iteration.
If n is 0, the code breaks out of the loop.
If the first character of the ans string is not 0, the code prints the ans string.
If the first character of the ans string is 0, the code prints the substring of the ans string starting from the second character.
